sen.j: 大粮（たいろう）とは、古代律令制において、中央官司のもとで働く仕丁・衛士・采女らに支給した食料。
sen.e: Tairo was the food supplied to Jicho (unpaid worker), Eji (guards) and Uneme (court ladies) working at the central government offices in the ancient Ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 財源は租庸調として令制国から徴収された米・塩・布・綿などであり、民部省より支給されることとなっていた。
sen.e: The income was rice, salt, cloth and cotton collected from Ritsuryo provinces as Soyocho and was supplied from the Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs).

sen.j: 各官司は毎月1回、所管の省に対して翌月支給すべき大粮の量とその支給対象者数を解_(公文書)の形で報告を行った。
sen.e: Each government office reported to their governing ministry in the form of a official document every month regarding the amount of Tairo for the next month and number of staff who will receive supplies.

sen.e: Receiving this, each ministry calculated the total Tairo as a ministry and submitted that bill to the Minbusho.

sen.j: 民部省は太政官より大粮支給許可の太政官符を受けて、各省を通じて翌月分の大粮を支給した。
sen.e: The Minbusho received a Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State) permitting the payment of Tairo and supplied the Tairo for the next month to each ministry.
